channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Delta’s secret trading card program has a new design for its 100th anniversary—but you’ll need to ask your pilot to get one
item.description: The trading cards feature a photo and a fun fact about the planes in Delta’s fleet.

item.title: Brazilian President Lula swipes at new 25% auto tariffs, saying Trump is president only of the U.S. not the world
item.description: “I am very concerned about the behavior of the American government,” Lula said.

item.title: Zonda’s chief economist never thought Trump, the only real estate mogul-turned-president, would place tariffs on building materials when housing is already so unaffordable. She was wrong
item.description: Ali Wolf went from feeling somewhat optimistic about the housing market to concerned in a matter of months. Blame the policy whirlwind.

item.title: Secrets on Signal
item.description: We explain how the group chat leak could have happened.

item.title: Rattled by Trump, America’s Allies Shift to Defense Mode on Tariffs
item.description: The new auto tariffs are straining relations with U.S. allies and deepening doubts about America’s reliability as a partner.

item.title: Houthis in Yemen Won’t Be Defeated by Airstrikes Alone, Experts Say
item.description: U.S. officials seek to curb the militants’ attacks on ships in the Red Sea, but the group was not deterred by strikes in the Biden era and won’t be be...

item.title: Glean CEO Arvind Jain: Lessons from an AI unicorn
item.description: For Glean CEO Arvind Jain, transitioning the company from a scrappy startup to an AI unicorn with nearly 800 employees has been a challenge.

item.title: European Leaders Try to Hammer Out Ukraine Support Plans
item.description: Over 30 officials gathered in Paris for the meeting. But who is willing to do what in this coalition is still unclear.

item.title: Gaia to Shut Down After More Than a Decade of Mapping the Milky Way
item.description: After more than a decade of mapping the stars, the European spacecraft was shut down on Thursday. But its legacy lives on.

item.title: A StubHub co-founder says he was scrubbed from the company’s history in its IPO filing: ‘It appears old wounds are deep enough to lie about the company’s founding story’
item.description: Jeff Fluhr dropped out of business school to become StubHub’s CEO, now he’s not receiving credit for his efforts as the company tries to go public.

item.title: Where Do You Bury a Nazi?
item.description: As the German right ascends, the nation is still grappling with its fascist past — and how to handle its remains.

item.title: Israeli Lawmakers Give Themselves More Power Over Choosing Judges
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu, the Israeli prime minister, appears to have returned to the contentious judicial overhaul that divided the country before the war ...

item.title: Houthis in Yemen Won’t Be Defeated by Airstrikes Alone, Experts Say
item.description: U.S. officials seek to curb the militants’ attacks on ships in the Red Sea, but the group was not deterred by strikes in the Biden era and won’t be be...

item.title: European Leaders Try to Hammer Out Ukraine Support Plans
item.description: Over 30 officials gathered in Paris for the meeting. But who is willing to do what in this coalition is still unclear.

item.title: South Sudan’s Vice President Machar Arrested, Party Says
item.description: The United Nations warned that the detention of Vice President Riek Machar threatens to push the world’s youngest country back into civil war.
